data.title: Barbara Spalding Obituary - Medfield, Massachusetts
data.meta_description: Spalding, Barbara (Farnham) , age 79, of Greenville, RI, formerly of Medfield, died peacefully on Saturday afternoon, October 8, 2011, at the Hebert Nursing Home in Smithfield, RI.   Born in Detroit, MI, on November 6, 1931, she was a daughter of the late Joseph E. and Mildred (Standiford) Farnham. Barbara was raised and educated in Burlington, VT. She continued her education at the University of Vermont where she became a proud member of Pi Beta Phi.   Barbara moved to the Boston area and was employed for several years as an assistant buyer for the Jordan Marsh Company. After marriage she made a home for her family in Medfield and enjoyed summers in West Alton, NH. Barbara served on a number of boards at the United Church of Christ, Medfield and delivered Meals on Wheels to people in Medfield, Franklin and Norfolk for many years. After forty happy years in Medfield, she moved to the Village at Waterman Lake in Greenville, RI, where she has enjoyed such activities as writing and reading poetry and being a Sunday oil painter.  Beloved wife of the late Richard Luce Spalding, she is survived by three sons, John Spalding and wife Jacqueline Ferriera Spalding of Glenburn, ME, Robert Spalding of Warwick, RI, and Philip Gregory Spalding and wife Jerilyn of Franklin; and three grandchildren, Jessica, John and Charles; and a sister, Jean Farnham Henshaw of Shelburne, VT. She was also the mother in law of the late Susan Ferriera Spalding.   Her funeral will be at the Roberts-Mitchell Funeral Home, 15 Miller Street, Medfield, MA, on Saturday, October 15th at 11:00a.m. Burial will follow at Vine Lake Cemetery. Visiting hours will be Friday 4 – 7pm.   If desired, donations may be made in Barbara’s memory to the American Red Cross, PO Box 4002018, Des Moines, IA 50340-2018.
